confirm_discovery_fire_tv.title: Notifications for Fire TV
confirm_discovery_fire_tv.description:
First, Home Assistant cannot currently distinguish Fire TVs from other Amazon devices. Select ignore if this is not a TV.

This integration requires the Notifications for Android TV app.

https://www.amazon.com/Christian-Fees-Notifications-for-Fire/dp/B00OESCXEK

You should set up either DHCP reservation on your router (refer to your router's user manual) or a static IP address on the device. If not, the device will eventually become unavailable until Home Assistant finds the new IP address.

confirm_discovery_android_tv.title: Notifications for Android TV
confirm_discovery_android_tv.description:
First, Home Assistant cannot currently distinguish some Android TVs from other Android devices. Select ignore if this is not a TV.

This integration requires the Notifications for Android TV app.

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=de.cyberdream.androidtv.notifications.google

You should set up either DHCP reservation on your router (refer to your router's user manual) or a static IP address on the device. If not, the device will eventually become unavailable until Home Assistant finds the new IP address.

user.title: Notifications for Android TV / Fire TV
user.description:
This integration requires the Notifications for Android TV app.

For Android TV: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=de.cyberdream.androidtv.notifications.google
For Fire TV: https://www.amazon.com/Christian-Fees-Notifications-for-Fire/dp/B00OESCXEK

You should set up either DHCP reservation on your router (refer to your router's user manual) or a static IP address on the device. If not, the device will eventually become unavailable.
